My sister had a BLT and potato salad. She said the BLT was good but the potato salad was more like onion salad. She couldn't eat it. Service was good. I'd go back.

sVcmUyAqSCLR_xXQPtSphQ.text: Just left 12 minutes ago. First time there. Absolutely True American Country food!!!!! Enjoyed it so much I downloaded their APP before I even got the bill. And ordered something to go! Jason seemed a little quiet and reserved from his customers, but polite and sufficient with his service. Wish they offered a military discount. But they do NOT. Still pleased and will return  again.

4-jkgIwINhThnvQPRhBdVw.text: I was expecting home made food but the burger was a cheap frozen patty like the ones you would get from the grocery store!  Tasted like crap!

eU7c3a4zs7xERpXJMABDHA.text: Ambiance: Very old school, family owned type of place. This is a place that reminds me of home where you walk in and immediately feel like family.  Food: Nice portion of food, not too much but not too little. I loved that they accommodates me since I am vegan.  Service: It was fast and efficient. My food came out nice and fast. Loved the attention especially when it came to my water!! (I hate when I have to ask for water lol)  I would highly recommend this place if you are looking for a nice hometown feeling!

880dhXqMTnjml7SYwUIwXA.text: went to this restaurant tonight ordered what was supposed to be a 10 oz.  rib eye steak. it was tough as leather and tasted burnt..more like a flank steak..it came with a salad which the lettuce was all wilted..the baked potato was good.!and the roll was good. So basically paid $22 for a potato and a roll! very disappointed!

BAiOWGL_DfmZQEpnWXl3SQ.text: This restaurant is separated from the bar on the other side by a short hallway, therefore it is not smokey or loud.    They are friendly and efficient.  I come here when I'm craving down home country cooking.  The beef stew is delicious.  And the apple pie is best-in-town.

A9ugMax_EDewGhb4FxQg8Q.text: This is definitely a go to for breakfast for the family! A little for everyone in the family. The server suggested a cinnamon roll pretty good. I had the chicken fried steak and was awesome like all the reviews said. Being from the south haven't had a good one in my 20 years living in Las Vegas. Most of them are frozen ones they try to pull off as their own recipe but this one truly is their own recipe. Server was great just wish they had more booths or different arrangement in the restaurant to accommodate a more comfortable restaurant.

f_bY1c9JEOUUxCNDZ9nfmQ.text: This is one of the best hidden gems in Las Vegas for nice country style food. It's very comfy.  Has great service.  Offers a great menu.  Serves food to adjacent bar (The Bounty) and its it's very tasty.    I've been to the bar several times and tried different things and haven't had a bad experience.   Today instead of going to the bar and sitting there to eat we decided to go into the restaurant.  Wow!   We have been missing out on a great experience.  Everything was perfect and we loved our food.   Whether your in the mood for a nice country style breakfast, lunch or dinner you need to try this.    Conveniently located on Rainbow/Cactus right in the heart of Mountains Edge

photos.caption: Photo of Our Families Country Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Our Families Country Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X8Z9RUlibRAnIADDbUlRcg.text: I love this restaurant.  My husband and I have been going to this restaurant for about a year now and we always have a great experience when we eat there.  The owner(s), waiters, waitresses, and cooks are very understanding of the types of allergies that you might have and they are knowledgeable of their items.    There are foods that we have tried and order the same foods every time we go there to eat.  Some of their are "Biscuits & Gravy", "Ribeye Steak", "Cowboy Burger", "Pancakes", "French Fries", "Salads", "Soups", and "Fish & Chips", to only name a few dishes are great and very tasteful.  Their "Iced Sweet Tea" is I think the best that I have ever tasted.    When we go there, we usually go there with another family of four (Husband & Wife, and their 2 daughters), and with me and my husband.  We all love going there to eat.   They are also located at the corner of "Cactus" & "Rainbow".   I can't wait to go there again.

Pzf0S4vF05txFFKQD6PdVw.text: My wife loves their breakfast.  I'm more of a lunch guy.   Their steak sandwich is perfect - a thin slice or ribeye steak on a bun --- cut thin enough that the meat is tender and eats like a sandwich made with deli meat --- but with the deliciousness of top grade steak.  I've also had their country nachos (quite good) and their club sandwich (good + huge portions).    If you try this place, you'll like it

REW7c9pzQg-C-HNzF9A0Iw.text: We ended up having breakfast here by "accident". We went to another restaurant around the corner and while the food is decent, we refused to wait 30-35 minutes because the owner didn't lease a sufficient sized space. Nope! So, in the car going to another destination, my honey suggested "the little country restaurant we saw around the corner". We decided to give it a try.   OMG! This place is amazing! We sat down immediately and were greeted as we walked in the door. The service is excellent! The owner even came and chatted with us and offered a fresh cinnamon roll fresh out of the oven while w. The restaurant is adorable! The food is delicious and plentiful. I'm full as a tick with a big left over box. Added bonus: the restaurant sells t-shirts of which the profits go to Wounded Warriors. As the fiancee of a combat veteran, this warmed my heart. We will definitely come here again.   *** we've been back 3 times since I posted this. Gotta say...they're consistent. No complaints at all.

vAECXHEoz2dTszzRtHPcJQ.text: My fiancee and I liked this spot, heard negative reviews about it but still gave it a shot and it didn't disappoint. We like that old country decor, and the food was good. Two thumbs up

H3cUny6UBmY4z4OibFiKhw.text: What a great place! The family feel was just what we needed. James with the pony tail is amazing. He made us laugh and kept checking on us. We will definately be back. Thanks Guys!!

geR5nV0bY23zoEPHqhSdog.text: Guys! This is our new spot right down the street from our new house! This cafe is open until 10pm! Hospitality was introduced right from the start with these guys. Humble and very kind these guys hustled out these plates and delivered A1 home cooked breakfast!  I had the Farmers breakfast 2 of everything! Sausage and bacon and home fries were  comes with hot cakes and biscuits and gravy.  My wife had the chicken fried steak! The crispy skin even after gravy was smothered! Oh my! Def broke the mouth.   Coffee guys the coffee was so good we had about 7-8 refills! 1 pod of creamer and it is just rich and perfect. The boys mentioned that they make coffee the right way and I believe it!   The service that was provided was awesome, very attentive to the customers and very much willing to accommodate anything. Def coming back next week!

photos.caption: Photo of Our Families Country Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If they offer it, it must be good right?!? Bomb right here! Not too sweet or heavy, just the right amount right before or after a meal.
Photo of Our Families Country Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmers breakfast, 2 of everything! (Eggs, bacon, sausage, home fries, biscuits &amp; gravy, and a pair of hot cakes) Flames!
Photo of Our Families Country Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak and eggs

AVu9zDD2gh_SSAeBNmqD9w.text: Best place for chicken fried steak! Came here many times for breakfast and the staff are amazing. They move fast to make sure we dont wait too long but either way, it is worth the wait. Love the country feeling and the decor. Food is amazing! Their pancakes are mouth watering as well as their home made cinnamon rolls. Yum!

F21x71SwrjfbNkc18O2FTw.text: I'm a pretty picky eater, but after trying this amazing little wonder, my husband and I plan to become regular customers. The food is fresh and tasty, the service fast and friendly, and the decor is positively charming.  The atmosphere is warm and inviting, just a cozy little jewel you shouldn't miss out on.  In Mountains Edge, nestled back off Cactus Rd, the Country Cafe has great food fairly priced, good sized portions, and two loyal new customers.

g4O60HAtT2oZEVrCu2zeiA.text: If you are craving a down home country breakfast, this place will hit the spot. The pork chops, chicken fried steak, and batter bites (season breakfast potatoes) are the best in the valley. I haven't had dinner there yet.  It's a quaint and warm environment. It's a little out of the way, but well worth the drive. They even have a car wash in the parking lot, so it'll be done by the time you finish eating. Getting to it is a little tricky...you MUST take Buffalo to Cactus. Turn left on Cactus. Restaurant is locate where street dead ends.  You will NOT be able to access via Rainbow, no matter what Mapquest shows.

G6x4REad2S63EvZPavjg6A.text: Great place and great food. Family atmosphere with all the harassment you would expect. :-)

WB_4FPBZ6cZU1MdRcO1sIA.text: Great service, relaxed home feel to the place.  We just moved to the area and happy to find a nice little spot.

BaTsQVIoHFvnvgjCdyR-gA.text: Hidin gem, worth the trip! Hard to find in Mountains Edge, follow the signs and they even offer a car wash / detail while you have breakfast!!

A3hKr47B3dbddZEUqThKnQ.text: The food is awesome.  Biscuits and gravy are the best.  A nice small family diner, definitely check it out if you're in the area!

QoWkJUTKjF8r9_pGIRYx6A.text: Absolute joke.  My wife and I went there because of the buy one get one coupon in the Value Pak.  Ok, the place may be located in the middle of nowhere, but if the food is good who cares, unfortunately, the food was HORRIBLE.  We go in, the place is nice.  It is small, with a country home type of vibe.  There were a few tables with people sitting and one waitress.  (This was a Wed. early afternoon.)  The waitress came by and was the most unpleasant person you could ask for.  No "How are you's?, Do you have any questions? First time here?"  Nothing.  She just asked, "Are you ready to order, then just looked at my wife."  She had the fried chicken, and I had the chicken fried steak.  Salad came first, it was filled with wilted, brown lettuce.  You couldn't, or didn't want to eat half of it.  (Now, I am NOT one of these weird picky people, I'm a hungry man, I'll eat most crap).  The food came out next.  My wife's chicken was fried to a burnt dry crisp.  The size of the chicken portion was so small it was a joke.  You have never seen a smaller wing.  I joked that it must have come from a chick.  You know the reject wings you may get at Buffalo Wild Wings when you order like twenty of them, yeah, these wings were smaller than those reject ones.  Garbage.    I had the chicken fried steak.  It was a tv dinner.  It was a breaded salisbury steak you get in a hungry man dinner.  They slop the mashed potatoes on top of it.  The potatoes were ok as were the rolls.      Waitress asked for our coupon when we ordered, I wonder if they give you crap food because of the two for one?  Wilted lettuce and mini chicken.  Maybe we got the wrong food, I don't know.  I ordered the chicken fried steak because it said on the coupon "Best in Vegas".  I thought the place was nice, maybe breakfast.     Now, this is my third review....all negative.  That's most likely what it's going to be.  I'll review positive places if I think they need the help (like a new place), usually they don't as people know they are good..  I just want to warn people to be careful of some of the bad experiences I've had.  I guess I'm still looking for that place that would be seen on Diners, Drive Ins, and Dives here in Vegas.

Pv2zpahBFgHj8bZieUfnng.text: My fiance and I have been here a handful of times, thanks to Groupon, and have always been very satisfied upon leaving. We usually go for breakfast and really feel we get a LOT of great food at a great price. The omelettes are delicious!!! And the pancakes are the best I've had in awhile. Definitely a hidden gem, love the homey feel and the staff is wonderful. We can't wait to go try out their lunch/dinner menu!!

H3wqxZ0s1EXgh7inN0hdTg.text: I live around the corner, and I come about twice a month. Great little family ran breakfast diner with a good selection of lunch items also. Reasonably priced. Service is ok, some times really good and some times below par. It's located next to a gaming bar so every once in a while you'll get a whiff of cigarettes. I enjoy eating here and will recommend it to anyone in the area.

N527w2O6dgzKht6u28633A.text: After reading some reviews, my friend invited me to breakfast. We arrived at 8am and I was surprised they only open at 8am as Vegas is a 24/7 town. I guess we're kind of spoiled. Anyways, the best time to go is early. We had great service from our server, the drink server, and the manager/owner. We found out that they've been around for about 6 years now. I tried their specialty chicken fried steak and I was not disappointed. It was fresh, crispy and light and the gravy was just right (not to salty or bland). There was so much food that I could only eat the steak and two over medium eggs. I had to take the pancakes and potatoes home for another meal. Next time I will have to try their cinnamon roll which they make fresh each day. If you are in the area, got to stop in and try this place. I'm definitely letting all my friends at church know about this little secret, tucked away at Mountains Edge/Southern Highlands.

DGRt9J--4LuqvBfXK8iQKg.text: I have to say the name is a bit misleading.  Country Cafe implies home cooking but what you get here seems to come from the freezer or a can.  That's not to say the food was bad, but not what we expected.    The food was on par with standard bar food, which makes sense because the cafe is attached to a bar!   My daughter had the pizza, and it was definitely a frozen brand name pizza, probably Red Baron.   My wife had the clam chowder.  She said it tasted like what one would get from the can in a grocery store.   I had the chicken fried steak.  It was pretty good, pillsbury biscuit and all.    The atmosphere was nice.  Quiet.   The staff, while not super friendly, did a sufficient enough job taking our order and bringing our food in a timely manner.     Prices were not outrageous.  We left fairly satisfied, but again were expecting something a bit different.   If you like typical Vegas bar food, you will like this place.

zEGShb9LkxcJQiXUHoOgNA.text: I was excited to have a breakfast place within walking distance from our new house.  I went there one time and received horrible service from one of the servers there.  I thought maybe it was a fluke, he wasn't having a good day, or whatever other excuse.  So, I tried it again and got the same grumpy, mean guy.  The food was okay, but I would definitely go again if they were more friendly.  For example, I asked what the potatoes were like and I got attitude as if I had asked him to explain a scientific concept.  I wish I could remember his name.  Nonetheless, I will not be visiting again due to the poor customer service.

s-TSmyhiOodR_pI2_KUV_w.text: I love their breakfast, I go Here every day off I can. They never cut corners and their food is very delicious

ku497bHtA6qjNS5rc4QJAg.text: Food is fantastic! Fresh, flavorful & hot each time. Would be a five star if the (sister) waitress wasn't in a bad mood all the time. We loved going there 3-4 a week but having to deal with a bad attitude is becoming a real turn off/ uncomfortable for our family.

YFWLONuqUqUydgHKmU7ivQ.text: Great place! Breakfast is amazing. Also the chicken fried chicken and steak. The portions are big and great for kids too they have toys for them to play with

-SNYDQ19RoR7o98KA0c-PQ.text: Not Horrible Not Great, my 1st time being here I ordered the corned beef hash and eggs w hot cakes and a sweet tea. Sweet tea was OK nothing special. The corned beef hash taste like it was out a can, yet made it a little crispy just how I like it. I like canned hash but I don't want that from a restaurant, I can do that at home myself. The eggs weren't real, egg beaters I guess. I love eggs and would never eat that mess. Disgusting.... home friend edible w peppers and onions but no real seasoning. Hot cakes not good, just taste like flour. Service about 5 different ppl came to my table doing a didn't job. 1 for drinks, 1 for to tell me who would take my order. 1 who took the order and forgot that i asked for cheese in my eggs. 2 to check on me. All were nice except the 1 taking the order. Bought the check quickly and took forever to cash me out. Only 2 customers, me and 2ppl at another table together.  Took so long I took a phone call finished then decided to write this review while I waited.....LOL. probly will never come back but i tried. ...

pdYl8hsPfEmkfJdpYF6rXw.text: Darn Good Country Breakfast (eggs, country fried steak that can be cut with a fork & home fries) that has the gravy from the biscuits in gravy. We went to get those but they were out of biscuits :-( Although they offered to do gravy and toast - I am from the south and there is no substitute for the biscuits (sorry). The environment is homey and they have purposely placed themselves sorta outta the way in order to keep the traffic down, the food excellent and the service friendly. We will definitely be going back as its in the neighborhood and a nice change from bar breakfast food :-)

fTYC_O2Ioicvv46OjubecQ.text: Best homemade potato chips I've ever had. Everyone at the table enjoyed their dishes as well (chicken fried steak sandwich, bacon cheeseburger, California burger, & quesadilla). Definitely will come back

Kh0T05N1TYJwNKiT6oupUA.text: After my first experience over year ago, I said I probably wouldn't be back....but I figured I'd give this place another chance hoping that I would get to try their corned beef hash that was unavailable my last visit. I was very pleased I was able to order it this time, and even more excited when it arrived to the table. My over easy eggs were cooked perfectly so I could dip those highly addictive batter bites (kinda like tater tots) in my runny yolk. The hash (note: the corned beef hash is not fresh, it's  the canned kine which I have no problem with as long as it's cooked properly) was SUPER ONO! Nice & crispy, just the way I like it. This is now my go to breakfast spot! Hooray for second chances!!!

SSOOeIDq1zO16ai9qnhTwQ.text: Service was great, portions were filling, and home fries are made fresh! It's definitely got a neighborhood feel.  The servers were very attentive and friendly. We will be back!

kg_rB8i8MVnHFSKcUNJuxg.text: Food is kind of overpriced for the quality but other than that it's a pretty decent place to grab a bite to eat

Eoksu2JNfoasdlptnzfKBA.text: First time here and by far the best coffee ever! Place is very nice and clean! Food omg! I found my new place for breakfast hands down!

d6yWW7nT8JOGcv3WIMFURQ.text: Been here twice so far. Upon entry, you seat yourself. This place is pretty much out in the middle of nowhere and you can't access from Rainbow. Use Buffalo to get to cactus and drive towards Rainbow.   First time: I got the Two Step Breakfast (two eggs, two bacon strips, two sausage links, two slices of toast OR two hot cakes) for $8.99.   Pretty standard breakfast dish. Nothing special to me.   Second time: Hotcake Sandwich (one big cake topped with two sausage patties, under two eggs any style) for $6.99.  Service is pretty standard.

photos.caption: Photo of Our Families Country Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits &amp; gravy with home style fries

FXCYKDaB1SMJXXVaqbwBjA.text: This place is awesome. The perfect relaxed family atmosphere and the staff is very friendly and accommodating. The food was really good. We had hamburgers and my husband was thrilled they serve breakfast all day. It was like being in a small town. Very comfortable. Will definitely be back.

Z70Kbng3jgZo79xmgfeIVg.text: Was upset because we were really excited about some country home cooking, but completely messed up our order. I paid an extra $3 for chicken instead of beef patty on the sandwich so when it was delivered I couldn't eat it. Also had a couple modifications that were ignored on other items (no jalapenos or no whip cream). Other than that their food was good and very "country" home cooking, just disappointed in the delivery.

0Jfamy0UYScDF7nRZqh7dA.text: I love the cinnamon rolls here. They are only available on the weekends but they are soooo good!  I went there during the week with my kids and it seems kids eat free as their meals where not on the check. That made it great!

JBPt5ubgu7d3TrGlQJkyOw.text: Great little spot for classic American fare.   We arrived around 11am for breakfast and the place had a good amount of people seated. We were lucky enough to arrive just as a booth became available. We were greeted quickly and drinks were brought out. The cups were so large, I didn't even need a refill. That's saying a lot since I'm the queen of refills. I was really impressed with the service. Everyone was very attentive. Refills were swift and food was extremely large portions.   I decided on the Wisconsin cheese omelet, my fella got the sausage and cheese omelet and my mom got a breakfast combination. We all decided on hot cakes as our sides. The food was quick and everything was great. The consensus was that the hot cakes were our favorites. They were fluffy and fabulous. Some of the best pancakes we've had in town. Everyone had a great meal. It's a bit of a drive from me, but worth it for some fantastic pancakes.   This is a family run business and almost everyone working here is related, so I'm all for supporting locally and family-run restaurants. Definitely give this place a chance. They also have a mobile car wash in their parking lot and you can put it on your food bill for convenience, if you're interested.   Just to note, unless you live in the area, it may be a little difficult to locate this restaurant. My GPS directed me all the way down Rainbow to the restaurant but the street comes to a dead end so make sure you follow the signs to the restaurant or call and they will direct you properly.

photos.caption: Photo of Our Families Country Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wisconsin omelet
Photo of Our Families Country Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Our Families Country Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert menu

VOI60CaTTsSTkQoVNR5FPQ.text: Being from the midwest, this place brings me back home! Delicious Fried Chicken - Fried Corn & Syrup is a must-have! Breakfast menu is expansive - we will be back for the AM grub!  Friendly staff & clean restaurant with a great atmosphere.

mYzXwa6wQR8coA7fjRxzSA.text: Good food, reasonable prices, cozy atmosphere, friendly staff.  Oh yeah, only minutes from home too! They have daily specials and a large selection on the regular menu.  We recommend the house special rib-eye sandwich and the chicken fried steak, though everything we've tried has been good.

JN83RMtEc0mPfVdcZwqFIw.text: We just started driving back to SD when kids asked for breakfast. We are not buffet people and love exploring small local places. Found this on Yelp, and it was an awesome find! Kind of far from the main roads, but totally worth it! They had fresh baked cinnamon roll, which was great! I had to try their special country nachos, which is essentially chicken fried steak and gravy on nachos and cheese, sprinkled with bacon. Lots of calories, but it was oh so good. Kids and husband loved their meals too (kids meals at $4.99 ea). We asked for to go cups to take our leftover drinks with us for the long drive home, and waitress gave us giant cups filled with our drinks! So nice :)  We will definitely be back here next time we're in LV.

Qto1HszS5Ks8zKSEunuWbQ.text: Since they are the only restaurant in the area, I really wanted to like them. I have been here a few times, each time was worse than before and I will not return again. Service is always horrible and most of the staff is rude. The food is the cheapest, most processed stuff I have ever seen. I wish someone else would take the restaurant over and serve real, fresh food. Stay away!

HBByi1GwEwVoMmT1l8JjDg.text: This place is right down the street from my house and I was so excited to see it was there!   I've eaten here about 7 times and the last handful of times I've come I have had poor Quality food and service.  The last time I came I had ordered a un sweetened ice tea, I was on a sugar detox for a health reason and when the waitress who was 11 or 12 served me she gave me my tea and I took a sip and it was VERY sweet.   When she came back I said "oh I'm sorry I thought I ordered unsweetened ice tea, could I get a new one?"   She gave me a dirty look and said "I gave you unsweetened". I said oh simple mistake but it's very sweet, I cannot have sugar, may I get another?.  She stood there and kept saying she did not make a mistake.   My friend sitting with me grabbed my drink and took a sip and said this has sugar in it. Get her another.  The girl grabbed my drink gave me a smile and walked away. It then took her about 10 min to bring back my tea.   After we ate her father who I'm pretty sure is the owner came over and said "simple mistake on the tea, can you really blame a 11 year old? And chuckled. He then made small talk about the situation. Very awkward.  Another time I came from breakfast with a friend and we found a hair in her pancake and she simply asked for another pancake. When the waiter came back he laugh and said " oh haha some of our workers have dogs, sorry about that". My friend and him went back and forth on this subject, let's just say she doesn't hold back words haha, we ended up leaving.   Super gross!!

TgDKH8PARhLV234RXwBhKw.text: Ok being that I grew up in shit kicker California I know country cooking. That was the best part of my childhood. Country fired stake, biscuit and gravy and all the good home style potato anyone could dream of was the only way you spend your weekend breakfast.  This place is pretty close. It is hard to find good ole country breakfast joints without them Vegasing it out when you are in a big city like Las Vegas but I have to say I am pretty lucky I live down the street from this restaurant.   I have to say it is kind of a neighborhood place tucked away in small almost none existence shopping center with only a bar right next to it right smack dab in the middle of Mountains edge master community.   But if you do decide to make an effort it is worth it. Food is good staff is great and price is just right. Oh and if you are a regular being your own mug for you cup of how they will keep it there for you so you can sip from your own favorite cup every time you visit, how cool and homey is that?   I'm a fan because it's the closet thing to home I can get!

photos.caption: Photo of Our Families Country Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sign out front such a weird location for a Resturant but who cares!
Photo of Our Families Country Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa what? How fancy is this country joint?
Photo of Our Families Country Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum old fashion biscuit and gravy. Now who doesn&#39;t like that!

Uw0kNV_kjLU6BZHLYLmxwQ.text: I've been to this restaurant several times and every single time i receive the best service. I had Belinda tonight and she was exceptional and attentive. Every single server (Daniel, James etc) are exceptional and attentive as well. My son and i love it here. I would have taken a picture of our food but my son and i were starving and since the food if legitimately home made we couldn't resist.

dj1tZW24hPKBHFzA5MAnXQ.text: Wow, cinnamon roll was so hot out of the oven fresh. Loved our deep voiced waiter, wonderful food and beyond good service.

GMfLmJF2YmBr1vvm0k6zZg.text: Best Biscuits and Gravy in town.  Love this place.

2MCM-smO3rl4jkYeEBxb_A.text: We had been looking forward to trying this place out, but have now given up. We went in and were asked to wait to be seated.  We waited about 10 minutes, despite a few empty tables. Other people came in and sat down and we're waited on immediately. When we pointed that out, the staff just stated they didn't read the sign to wait. Still not seated, we left and will not be returning.

41sS4Quq_2ncrvagDoa1rg.text: Just WOW!  Great breakfast!  Good food, great staff, and good price!  I'm an EastCoast girl and most places NEVER get the corned beef hash right (it's usually big stringy pieces of corned beef).  This place has it going on. If you're in Southern Highlands or Mountains Edge it's so convenient, but is worth the drive from ANYWHERE!

UM107hMqQQI2zostho4TnQ.text: Not a bad dinner.  Order through grub hub so maybe that effected the food.  I got chicken fried chicken, mashed potatos, and green beans.  Also got a bowl of chicken noodle.  The soup was really good.  The entree was ok.  CFC was kind of dry but the gravy provided some good favor.   We will try it again, but will make the trip down there.

yJp9D0SFwvtFxLyAC4F0_g.text: Good food small town feel. Great AC! Staff very friendly. Had the chicken protein platter was a little small but very flavorful. Will be coming back soon.

dIoCn-iJjbGt-m4lIlq2Xw.text: We seem to always on the hunt for new breakfast places, and I found this spot via recommendation from a friend.  My Husband was having the windows on his car tinted, and we were nearby, so we decided to stop in. First of all, the directions that Google Maps gave us were super weird - it had us turn into and drive through a small residential area, when it wasn't necessary. It was actually pretty funny.   It was a Saturday morning and there was no wait, which was fantastic! The service was fast and friendly - my husband ordered an omelet and I had chicken fried steak. We also ordered something from the kids menu for our daughter. Everything was to our liking and we had no complaints. The prices are very reasonable as well! It's not necessarily near our house, but it's a place we will definitely return to when we're looking for breakfast in the area.

0dg9eATBeJBjWa8nTncZlw.text: We always pass this place, and finally stopped in for dinner. The decor is very country, cozy even. Like going to grandmas house. There are random things hanging on the wall, pictures to look at, it's super cute!   Around the table we had the chicken fried steak sandwich, BLT club, country nachos and fried chicken. If you love gravy, this is the place for you. Everything has yummy gravy! The nachos, GRAVY. I never knew chips and gravy would be a hit. The fried chicken had hints of honey, just enough sweetness to warm your belly.   All the yummy food, but only 3 stars you ask?? The service was very slow. We were 1 of 3 other families in the restaurant. I'm not sure how long the other 2 families were seated before we arrived, but their food wasn't even on the table yet. I looked at my watch a few times before our food came out - about 30 mins had passed. Also, our waitress only came out once to refill our water cups. Waiting for the check was interesting, since our waitress hadn't been out in a while. My husband ended up walking to the kitchen door to pay. Maybe this is normal? I'm not sure.

1l5GODddbXygRDNG6QWOYQ.text: I had the bacon cheeseburger with steak fries, and it was DELICIOUS!! My hubby had the eggs and pancakes and he loved them too! The food was so great/great prices too, the staff was friendly and very attentive, and the restaurant was very cute, clean, and organized. You should eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Our Families Country Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Cheese Burger

ju2dilG98tOf9FMPcenqvw.text: I have returned many times since my first review. Always friendly and knowledgeable staff. Food comes pretty fast and your coffee cup doesn't stay empty. They provide flavored creamers-which I love. Be sure to tell your server exactly how you like your eggs or pancakes and they will do their best to accommodate your request. It's an easy-going atmosphere and they don't seem to mind if you linger over your coffee.

9WgkGb-QWivoZb6hhLL3fg.text: If you want some good breakfast you mine as well just go to McDonald's drive thur. We came here for the first time and we got our order taken and our food came but as we were waiting another server (he had his hair in a bun) he was offering his tables coffee cake they only do on Saturday and Sunday's. He was not our server so I did not expect him to ask us. But he asked all his tables all his tables were laughing and joking with him! I really wish we had him. Anyways , we ordered hotcakes and the server gave us almost gone syrup we nodded refills on water NOT ONCE were we asked if we needed anything . They saw we needed water they saw we needed syrup but they were QUICK to bring us our check ! Will never go here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Our Families Country Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We asked for syrup....
Photo of Our Families Country Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was the only good thing about the restaurant
Photo of Our Families Country Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s not like they were busy

8Oc5K9dCgVp__1oC1YbVGg.text: Randomly found this place on my drive home, it's pretty hidden and if you're not paying attention, you could accidentally drive right past it.  Turned onto a semi gravel road to what looked like just a random bar but on the right was this little restaurant.  As you walk in it gives you a nice homely feeling with pictures on the wall paying respects to our armed forces, wooden tables with what looked like hand made benches from trees chopped out back and the nicest lady greeting me with the biggest smile.  Service was of course outstanding, constantly checking up on me, water always topped off and recommendations on the menu.  I went with the suggestion of the special. Chicken parmesan. The noodles were not overcooked, it was spot on, the chicken was tender and flavorful not to mention the clam chowder that came with the meal was delicious.  Honestly I cant believe this place was so close to my house and this was the first time I decided to check them out. I would have came in a lot more.
